newsitem.title: JAPAN: Fuji Television set to buy stake in JSkyB--paper.
newsitem.headline: Fuji Television set to buy stake in JSkyB--paper.

text.p: Fuji Television Network Inc is likely to buy a stake in Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB), the satellite broadcasting venture of Softbank Corp and News Corp Ltd, the Japanese mass-circulation daily Asahi Shimbun reported in its evening edition on Friday.
The nationwide broadcaster is a unit of Nippon Broadcasting System Inc, which listed its shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange's second section in December 1996.
A spokesman for Fuji Television said JSkyB had asked the firm to take a stake in the venture but added that no agreement had yet been reached.
The paper said Fuji Television would likely be the first television network in Japan to take part in the digital satellite business.
Electronics giant Sony Corp has also said that it will participate in JSkyB.
Softbank president Masayoshi Son has said that Sony's capital participation in the venture will be equal to that of Softbank and News Corp, which is led by media tycoon Rupert Murdoch.
The paper said that Fuji is also seeking an equal stake in the venture.
It said Fuji will supply programming to JSkyB, which is expected eventually to offer 150 channels.
Walt Disney Co may also buy a stake in JSkyB, the paper said.
Spokesmen for Sony and Softbank were not immediately available to comment on the report.
